Nerangs.ab: nirang barsom čidan naḫost haft šāh barsom pāk bāyad kardan va dast be pādyāv kardan va čon barsom mičinand pošt bar barsom-e pāk nakonand ke be hič kār našāyad va baʿd az ān šāḫ-i ke se tāk-e barsom dāšte bāšad peydā konand va dast-e rāst bā kārd az sar se tāk barsom gozārand xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ aṣ̌əm vohū se goftan

"The cutting of the barsom. First, one must clean seven branches for the barsom. He must wash his hands with pādyāv. When they cut the barsom, they do not turn their back to the pure barsom that would be not usefull for nothing (in other case). Afterwards, they have to find a branch that might provide three barsom-twigs. They lean his hand together with the knife on the three barsom-twigs."

ke barsam cinand benazdik-e urvar šavand haft tā pāk konand va dast barsamdān bepādyāv kardan va barsam-cin va dast bepādyāv kardan va ān barsam ke ḫᵛāhand cidan bāyad gereftan xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ aṣ̌əm vohū ĪĪĪ

"When they cut the barsom, they go next to the plant, clean seven pieces and they must wash with pādyāv the hands and the barsomdān and also the barsom-cin and the hands. They shoul grab the barsom they want to cut (and recite) xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ and three Aṣ̌əm Vohū."
